column3: It was two minutes past nine. Hanley nodded to the chief housing officer. "Proceed," he said. The council officer approached the door of the house and knocked loudly.

We were rolling down an expressway, somewhere, but rain was clouding the view of the skyline so that I couldn't orient myself to where we were. The glowing numbers of the dashboard clock said that it was only a few minutes after nine.
9:02 am lay in bed, staring at ceiling.
